result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas William Wontor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
3 1/2 years WI State Prison (18 months IC/2 years ES) concurrent with current revocation on Sheboygan County case #15CF348. Eligible for SAP. 125 days credit.
Concurrent with: with Sheboygan County case #15CF348

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment/follow through w/ recommended treatment/counseling

Absolute sobriety.
No possession/consumption of alcohol, controlled substance w/out valid Rx, and/or drug paraphernalia.
No establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

COMPAS evaluation/follow through w/ recommendations
Take all medication as prescribed.

Court costs of $288 and DNA surcharge of $250 payable to the COC office at the rate of $50/month commencing one month after release from incarceration. Submit DNA sample. Supervision fees payable to DOC during ES. Default of payment debt referred to SDC.

records.addlTxt: 10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas William Wontor in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Nicholas William Wontor. Court makes stmt re meeting w/ counsel in chambers prior to calling the case. Court makes stmt re jail credit (125 days). ADA Lasee makes stmt re clarification to PSI on the record. No other additions or corrections to the factual content of the PSI. Court makes stmt regarding the correction made to the written plea negotiations. Atty Hansen reads email received from DA Burke clarifying the negotiations on the record. State's recommendation. Atty Hansen makes stmt. Defendant makes stmt. Court makes stmt. Court makes stmt. Court sentence: 3 1/2 years WI State Prison (18 months IC/2 years ES) concurrent to revocation on Sheboygan County case #15CF348, 125 days credit, eligible for SAP, conditions of ES; absolute sobriety, no possession/consumption of alcohol, controlled substance w/out valid Rx, and/or drug paraphernalia, no establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, obtain/maintain full time employment, take all medication as prescribed by a Dr and approved by agent, AODA assessment/follow through, COMPAS evaluation/follow through, court costs of $288 and DNA surcharge of $250 payable to the COC office at the rate of $50/month commencing one month upon release from incarceration, submit DNA sample. Default of payment debt referred to SDC. Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation.

State's Exhibit #1 - plea negotiations

09:17 AM Defendant Nicholas William Wontor in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Nicholas William Wontor. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. State's Exhibit #1 - marked/received/reviewed by the Court. DA Burke makes correction to offer on the record. Counsel in agreement. Defendant waives formal reading of charge and enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 1. Balance of charges dismissed/read-in. PLQ received/reviewed by the Court w/ the defendant. Voting and firearm warnings given. Court finds defendant's plea to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the plea. Factual basis found. Adjudged guilty. Atty Burke makes stmt. Court orders PSI. Present bond cont'd.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court further finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and bounds defendant over to the circuit court. Court proceeds w/ ARGN. ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff
Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff

Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/co defendant  V.H.
